snippet: In the first known birth of its kind in the United States, a California woman has given birth to a girl using sperm retrieved from her dead husband, raising ethical questions over whether a man must give his consent to be a father.    The sperm wa...
lead_paragraph: In the first known birth of its kind in the United States, a California woman has given birth to a girl using sperm retrieved from her dead husband, raising ethical questions over whether a man must give his consent to be a father. The sperm was retrieved 30 hours after the man's death and then frozen for 15 months before use. His wife, Gaby Vernoff, became pregnant in July 1998 and delivered the girl on March 17 in a Los Angeles hospital.
abstract: California woman, Gaby Vernoff, gives birth to girl using sperm retrieved from her husband 30 hours after his death; ethics questions discussed (S)

headline.main: A Birth Spurs Debate on Using Sperm After Death
